result.execSummary:
The defendant Sadie R. Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Sixteen days credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadie R. Gray

records.addlTxt: plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

9:32 AM cases 22CF43, 22CF1118, 22CF1122, 22CF1133 cases called. Defendant Sadie R. Gray in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Sadie R. Gray.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. In 22CF1118, 22CF1133: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
There is an agreement which the Defense recites. Court finds defendant Guilty in 22FO1247 and orders court costs. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 22CF1133: Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping. 
In 22CF43: Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin). 

Court accepts pleads and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 30 months with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant to pay court costs and provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant has 12 days in 22CF1133 and 16 days sentence credit in 22CF43 if revoked from Probation. 

Any contraband seized is to be destroyed.
Plea hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Sadie R. Gray not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Sadie R. Gray. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. Defendant was supposed to be driving here from South Dakota to appear in person. 
Plea Hearing: 10/19/22 at 9:30am Defendant may appear via Zoom per court.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
